SubContent: {1: "Simulation Hall Maintenance Feedback Sheet\\nRating: ☆☆☆☆☆\\n\\Comment: Excellent service and attitude. An overall satisfying experience. They even added a new feature module to the simulation hall that allows us to experience a simulated demolition. We are happy to have it even though I'm not sure if it could bring us more customers."}

Name: Half Note Torn off From the Report
Title: Half Note Torn off From the Report
SubContent: {1: '\\nI used to wonder why they kept investing manpower and material resources into exploring things that are useless for modern technology. Our technology now is enough to create artworks way brilliant than the old ones.\\n However, I saw a mural on the WGAA expedition last time.\\nIt was probably an ancient Kowloong mural. It contains the celestial beings and buildings on the top, human emperors in the middle, and demons and monsters at the bottom.\\nI stared at the mural and tears just came to my eyes unconsciously.\\nI thought I finally got it.'}

Name: A Sticky Note in Exploration Report Pages
Title: A Sticky Note in Exploration Report Pages
SubContent: {1: "\\nDarling, I'll be returning soon.\\nOur expedition on the ground has yielded fruitful results. We found the original manuscripts of some very ancient books. Although some of the poems can be found in Babylonia's terminal, contents like these have more vivid descriptions than the records...\\n\\n(There is a photo stuck at the bottom of the note. In the photo, there is an old book page with the following line of words:)\\nThe twilight sky, in my eyes, is a window and a light, and someone waiting behind that light."}

Name: Science Council Internship Evaluation
Title: Science Council Internship Evaluation
SubContent: {1: "[Internship Evaluation]\\n\\nYou have passed the evaluation for your excellent performance of acting actively, bravely, and calmly and bringing back a batch of Hetero-Creature samples.\\n\\n(... Killing a Hetero-Creature should not be included here. It wouldn't increase your rating even if you add it here, so stop asking about it!)"}

Name: Journal in a Ground Institute
Title: Journal in a Ground Institute
SubContent: {1: "Institute Journal\\n\\nAnother boring day.\\nNo new data. No new research direction. No idea on the subject at hand. I opened the terminal trying to start a new thesis proposal without anything coming to my mind.\\nIt feels there's nothing to build on...\\nWhen will they get me back to Babylonia? I really miss the days working overtime with Mr. Asimov. The taste of the strong coffee I had is still lingering in my mouth when I think of it..."}

Name: Note Found in the Joint Scientific Research Institute
Title: Note Found in the Joint Scientific Research Institute
SubContent: {1: "\\nI brought a snowflake for you. I made it in the Arctic Route Union. It's a snowflake from the north pole.\\nA snowflake I sealed in the polyvinyl acetal synthetic resin solution that cost me a lot of Black Cards. I spent a great deal of spare time on trials to finally get it.\\nI hope you can think of me when you see it. And I can immediately feel it when you think of me...\\nI love you. I'll come home soon."}

Name: Note With Scribbles
Title: Note With Scribbles
SubContent: {1: "\\nThank you, uncle, for teaching me to write my name.\\nMom was happy.\\nMom said the uncle was a scientist from above.\\nI want to be a scientist when I grow up.\\nI'll study hard.\\nHope uncle has a safe journey."}

Name: A Paper Torn From a Notebook
Title: A Paper Torn From a Notebook
SubContent: {1: "\\nToday, we came across an abandoned research institute.\\nI'm scared to see research institutes like this. It always gives me the feeling that another me is gone along with the building.\\nIf I hadn't caught up with the flight back to Babylonia, if there had not been the protection of the Constructs, if...\\nIf anything happened, I would have died in the institute. I wonder if the dead researchers thought the same in the parallel worlds.\\nBut there is nothing I can do. All I can do is to work faster on the research projects at hand. Hope... we could remove the Punishing Virus from this world one day."}

Name: A Torn-Apart Sticky Note
Title: A Torn-Apart Sticky Note
SubContent: {1: '\\n(The handwriting on the note is messy.)\\n\\nThese might be my last words.\\nAll the money is behind the shelves in the place you know.\\n\\n(The note comes with an old badge.)'}

Name: Note Under the Desk of the Star of Life
Title: Note Under the Desk of the Star of Life
SubContent: {1: "\\nWow! The Constructs who were here for the exchange are all awesome! I heard they are all from an elite squad, and they could make it to give us the lecture on first aid because they happened to have the time...\\nI also heard that even Constructs like them could also get wounded in ground battles... What is the situation down there? I'm a bit scared and a bit curious...\\nAm I able to help on the battlefield? Am I able to complete such missions like the senior students?"}

Name: Small Note Left in Temporary Conservation Area First Aid Station
Title: Small Note Left in Temporary First Aid Station
SubContent: {1: 'Journal of My First Ground Mission\\n\\nMy senior classmate said it was also her first time being in such danger... We were trapped with the support team in an abandoned factory by the Corrupted. There were two injured team members. My senior classmate decided to stay to protect them and asked me to leave for help.\\nI was scared, but I knew she was giving me the chance to survive. And I would also bring back that hope of survival to them.\\nFortunately, I made it back in time with the Constructs who came to support us to save my wounded senior classmate.\\nShe said that I did a good job and gave me the excellent rating.\\nI think I know what to do in the future.'}

Name: Diary Left in Star of Life First Aid Station
Title: Diary Left in Star of Life First Aid Station
SubContent: {1: "\\nAnother thank you letter from Constructs. We've had a lot of them.\\nIt was a snap decision to come to the Star of Life. I even got scared to tears seeing the vital fluid all over the place. But now I'm completely used to it.\\nAlthough working overtime and having no days off are a norm here, every Construct we saved adds up the hopr for Babylonia to survive...\\n\\n(The rest is some scratches. The writer was probably up to other things.)"}

Name: Small Note Left in the Corner of the First Aid Station
Title: Small Note Left in the Corner of the First Aid Station
SubContent: {1: "\\nI'm so sleepy... Should I apply for a Construct surgery? Do Constructs get exhausted by working overtime? Those Construct girls always look so full of energy...\\nI'd better get some heart care drugs. Otherwise, I might be the one on the operating table of the Star of Life next and the cause of death is probably... sudden cardiac death due to overwork...\\nPhew..."}

Name: Note Found in the Oasis Camp Tent
Title: Note Found in the Oasis Camp Tent
SubContent: {1: "\\nThe battle is over.\\nWe got rid of the Corrupted who got in. The high Punishing Virus concentration makes me worried about the safety of other humans in the camp because we don't have much serum left, nor enough supplies to exchange for more serum.\\nBut the good news is that the grain we planted are ready to be harvested. We don't need to worry about food at the camp from now on.\\Being able to memorize physics from the Golden Age doesn't do any good in this world. I still need to fight for enough food.\\n..."}

Name: Short Note Fill of Tear Stains
Title: Short Note Fill of Tear Stains
SubContent: {1: "My child, your dad may have gone by the time you see this note.\\nThe only thing I can leave for you is these three bags of grain. Keep two as food and use the other one as seeds. When everyone is out planting seeds, you plant them in the field and they will grow food he next year.\\nDon't worry and don't be afraid. Just follow our leader.\\nMy child, hope is like a seed. You plant it and it will sprout and bloom. As long as we continue to work hard for generations to come, one day we will...\\n"}

Name: A Line Written on the Back of the Defenses Reconstruction Report
Title: A Line Written on the Back of the Reconstruction Report
SubContent: {1: "\\nWhat's the point to build defenses?\\nEvery time after we built the defenses, those damn Corrupted would come and ruin them! We built again and they destroyed them again! All those efforts and for what? Those defenses were fragile like paper! They can't even stand any attacks from the Corrupted! Useless!\\nPst.\\nLeave it! I'll do it! Always so stingy! We wouldn't have to rebuild like this over and over again if we had good materials!"}

Name: A Note on the Table in an Oasis Tent
Title: A Note on the Table in an Oasis Tent
SubContent: {1: "\\nThere are always Scavengers wanting to join us, but we have stopped accepting them now.\\nWe were always happy to invite Scavengers to stay if they wanted to a long time ago in the hope that we could work together. But... some Scavengers thought differently.\\nThey wanted free supplies and food but were not willing to work for them. Not long after, there were conflicts between the Scavengers and the natives for the natives hated the Scavengers for being freeloaders. In the end...\\nWell, let's hope the negotiation goes well."}

Name: A Note Left Deep Into the Wheat Field
Title: A Note Left Deep Into the Wheat Field
SubContent: {1: "\\nI sneaked back to New Oakley for a look. The town was not able to rely on the Forsaken for defense anymore. I wondered how they had been doing.\\n...\\nThey didn't look good. The planting area has shrunk to a few wheat fields. Only a small part of the golden fields was still there...\\nBesides, they started to buy weapons again. Some townsfolks gathered together to set up a defense line to protect their hometown.\\n..."}

Name: Small Note on the Abandoned Research Station's Table
Title: Small Note on the Abandoned Research Station's Table
SubContent: {1: "\\nI'm tired of fighting.\\nIt has been ten days since I lost contact with the port. I'm running out of food and ammo.\\nWhy can I just be a salted fish. This way, I can eat myself.\\nAh... It seems I've started to talk nonsense... Although the fact that I know I was talking nonsense proves that I haven't lost my mind, there's nothing I can do except talking nonsense.\\nThe Corrupted are still staring at me out there. They don't eat human flesh at all. Then why the hell do they stare at us...?\\nAm I able to make it until any Construct comes to save me...?"}

Name: Small Note Left on the Port First Aid Station Bed
Title: Small Note Left on the Port First Aid Station Bed
SubContent: {1: '\\nThank God, I was saved, peace & love. I have to say thank you to the Salted Fish God I worshipped when I almost lost my mind. It must be the Salted Fish God who led the support Babylonia Constructs to me.\\nNow I had some hot tea. Life is beautiful again. I have to work hard and try to finish the research project at hand before the end of the year! I can do it!'}

Name: Sticky Note Left in the Sea Surface Observation Station
Title: Sticky Note Left in the Sea Surface Observation Station
SubContent: {1: "\\nI noticed the strange movements under the ice some time ago. There are always strange sounds coming from the port with the icebreaker in the back.\\nWere they caused by bionic machines from the same batch of Derek? Or just sea creatures? Or... the monsters named Hetero-Creatures? Have they already reached the sea?\\nI hope it's one of the first two possibilities.\\nThe support from Babylonia is about to arrive. I think... we will find it out someday.\\n"}

Name: Seems to Be a Short Nursery Rhyme
Title: Seems to Be a Short Nursery Rhyme
SubContent: {1: '(These scribbles seem to be a nursery rhyme.)\\n\\nA spruce born and raised in the forest.\\nEvergreen, she braves the snowstorm.\\nGo to sleep, spruce, for winter has come.\\nLet the snowball warm you. Let the wind rock your cradle.\\nA spruce born and raised in the forest.\\nShe will sprout again in the next spring.'}

Name: A Sticky Note Next to the Icebreaking Vehicle
Title: A Sticky Note Next to the Icebreaking Vehicle
SubContent: {1: "\\nThe icebreaking vehicle is great! I guess we could only see things like this in the Arctic Route Union!\\nI was having trouble getting the supplies in with the original vehicle, and the Arctic Route Union sent this big guy right away after communication. This is so much fun! The ice on the road were broken directly! Some even got melted!\\nI would definitely stay for more days if I didn't have other missions to do... I have to accept missions here next time and drive it to my heart's content!"}

Name: A Record Note Left in the Ruins
Title: A Record Note Left in the Ruins
SubContent: {1: "White Crane Bay Ruins Exploration Notes\\n\\nWe excavated some copper warriors today. These lifelike warriors, in various vivid shapes, seem to be ancient Kowloong people's burial objects.\\nThankfully, they didn't have the technology to manufature intelligent devices, otherwise... Who knows what will happen if these copper warriors got infected by the Punishing Virus...\\nWell... Forget about it. Let's hurry up and clean this copper warrior up!"}

Name: Small Note Left in the Garrison Point Next to the Ruins
Title: Small Note Left in the Garrison Point Next to the Ruins
SubContent: {1: "\\nIt's raining.\\nNo water in the excavation grids. It's a good sign. Thanks to the modern technology, we've gotten the canopies ready days before the rain. Those Corrupted won't come because their limbs got corroded by the rain.\\nGreat time to write an exploration report... Where did the Golden Age potsherds and metal fragments go? Let's take them out for a wash. And with the sound of the rain, let me tell you about the life of people in the Golden Age and the times before that..."}

Name: Sticky Note on he Table of the Kowloong Research Institute
Title: Sticky Note on he Table of the Kowloong Research Institute
SubContent: {1: "\\nWanna know the secret hidden deep in Kowloong? Wanna why the newly found ruins to the southeast of Kowloong are still not excavated? Wanna know why there are strange movements and roars coming from the depths of the ruins? Please purchase this issue of Kowloong Exploration Tabloid!\\nAhhh—! It hurts! Master! I'm sorry! I'm just trying to raise some money for the exploration... The tablet sells well! The donation we received last time was also from... Ahhh! My ear is gonna fall off! Master! Master!"}

Name: Sticky Note Next to the Kowloong Vehicle
Title: Sticky Note Next to the Kowloong Vehicle
SubContent: {1: "\\nWhat? Only rations again this noon?\\nC'mon! I know it's tough on the trip, but can we please at least have rations of other flavors? It's always sweet rations! I can't even have a bite of these! Why don't we have spicy rations? A spoon of chili oil will be enough!\\nWoo... I can't stand a single day without chili... When can I get back to Kowloong...?"}

Name: Half of an Old Report on the Exploration of the Kowloong Ruins
Title: Half of an Old Report on the Exploration of the Kowloong Ruins
SubContent: {1: '(The first half of the text is blurry and unreadable.)\\n\\nThe ruins are partly destroyed by the Corrupted, but we came in time and saved a batch of precious culture relics.\\nThe biggest discovery this time is a jade elephant vase from the times before the Golden Age with a poem at the bottom.\\nAlthough the Punishing Virus is still spreading with more dark days to come, we believe that one day, our city, Kowloong, will be peaceful and prosperous again.'}

Name: [The Nighter Base Construction Plan]
Title: [The Nighter Base Construction Plan]
SubTitle: {1: '[The Nighter Base Construction Plan]'}
SubContent: {1: '...\\nNow with the two locations that are not suitable excluded, we still have three locations remaining as attached to the plan.\\nOur first choice is the first location. Based on the planned city gate, there will be a flat land outside the south city gate. The land on the south is lower than the middle with a river on the side for water transport. And the vast plains can be used to plain grain. It is overall a location with great potential and suitable for a new stronghold city.\\n...'}

Name: Sorry, I won't do it again.
Title: Sorry, I won't do it again.
SubTitle: {1: '[A Self-Reflection Letter]'}
SubContent: {1: "...\\nI apologize for not handing in the Instructor Terminal immediately after picking it up but instead deciphering it.\\nI apologize for sending the commission through the Commission System on the Instructor Terminal afterward.\\nBut I...\\nI really wanted to listen to Gray Raven Commandant's lecture! After all, my commission request got the commandant here! What about you guys, huh? Don't you feel ashamed of blaming for sending the commission while fighting for seats on the terminal?"}

Name: Babylonia's 1st Workaholic Contest
Title: Babylonia's 1st Workaholic Contest
SubContent: {1: "(An excerpt from the terminal)\\n\\n—\\nBabylonia's 1st Workaholic Contest? The winner definitely goes to Gray Raven Commandant! I feel like the commandant is always working.\\n—\\nNo one nominates Strike Hawk Commandant Chrome?\\n—\\nDon't just look at the commandants! I think Celica should win this! She works hard every day!\\n—\\nIt should be Asimov in my opinion... (From an exhausted research guy who just got off work from the Council.)\\n—\\n... Asimov +1\\n—\\nAsimov +1... No one beats him in this..."}

Name: Application to Construct a Base Outside the Conservation Area
Title: Application to Construct a Base Outside the Conservation Area
SubTitle: {1: '[Draft of Constructing a Base Outside the Conservation Area]'}
SubContent: {1: '...\\nThere are too many Scavengers and refugees. The destruction of conservation area defenses and thefts are common these days. The root cause of this is the lack of fixed source of supplies for Scavengers.\\nNow that the conservation area got larger due to the Clean Zone, we apply to build a temporary base outside the conservation area in the Clean Zone to reclaim the land and shelter filtered Scavengers and refugees. This will increase the manpower in the conservation area and form an area of defense to prevent the Scavengers and refugees from destroying the internal defenses in the conservation area.\\n...'}

Name: Report on a Mysterious Person Named Sephone
Title: Report on a Mysterious Person Named Sephone
SubTitle: {1: '[Report on a Mysterious Person Named Sephone]'}
SubContent: {1: '...\\nRecently, many Constructs and conservation area residents outside the area have claimed to see a "vehicle full of flowers." A lot of them were saved by its owner, a mysterious guy named "Sephone".\\nI went through the frames of these Constructs and tracked the health conditions of these residents, and they were all cured.\\nIt suggests that "Sephone" is good at curing humans and Constructs and is not hostile.\\nAlthough his/her identity still remains a secret, please ask him/her to leave his/her contact info if you see him/her. I have some medical questions to ask.\\n...'}

Name: Page Torn from A School Notebook
Title: Page Torn from A School Notebook
SubContent: {1: "\\n[As the flames spread in the distance, the pioneers' robes become stained with blood]\\n[I bid farewell to yesterday's campus, armed with everything I have been taught]\\n\\nTheir eyes sparkle, filled with hope for the future.\\n\\n[A road emerges from the ruins, marked by the footsteps of all of those who went before us]\\n..."}

Name: Anonymous Note Put on Bulletin Board
Title: Anonymous Note Put on Bulletin Board
SubContent: {1: "\\n What a sweatshop! I can't believe we don't get off until 10:30 every night! For God's sake, I didn't even work like this when I was plastering walls in the Engineering Force! \\n—Anonymous Construct 1\\n\\nI second that! We should overthrow the sweatshop! We Constructs must protect our own rights! \\n—Anonymous Construct 2"}

Name: A Lost Memo
Title: A Lost Memo
SubContent: {1: "\\nWe got the application from Strike Hawk for Wanshi's new frame. I really hope the higher-ups give it the green light so we can wrap up the development."}

Name: Anonymous Diary Outside Oasis
Title: Anonymous Diary Outside Oasis
SubContent: {1: '\\nBallard is dead.\\nBut it is not over. It seems that many things are no longer the same.\\nWhile those swayed by Ballard\'s deceit have gradually calmed and rallied around Watanabe, some armed groups remain harboring hatred toward Babylonia. Under the banner of Ballard, they keep invoking Ballard\'s promises, trying to incite more people to despise Babylonia.\\n"Free mankind from Babylonia\'s oppression so everyone can find their place in the Clean Zone."\\nSigh... Is it really feasible to achieve it?\\nI just want to live in peace.\\nHowever, as the world is right now... is it really possible to continue living in peace?'}

Name: A Tattered Arrest Warrant
Title: A Tattered Arrest Warrant
SubContent: {1: '\\nBabylonia Purifying Force is searching for an escaped test Construct of the Kurono Group. The test subject is armed with special weapons and is highly dangerous. Do not engage if you encounter her. Report to the Purifying Force immediately.\\nThe external appearance of this test subject is characterized as...\\n\\n(The lower part of the paper is blurred.)\\n\\nThe arrest warrant has been voided.'}

Name: Tattered Newspaper 1
Title: Tattered Newspaper I
SubContent: {1: '#Professor Kiril Gorputte Makes Public "Confession" in His New Autobiography\\nA reporter from a news agency received the latest "novel" by Professor Kiril Gorputte.\\nAside from a few episodes from his early life, the book describes how the "protagonist," over fifteen years as a psychiatrist, persuaded and incited 13 people to commit suicide.\\nAll were patients he had treated for mental illnesses, with the latter half of the book including the actual case files of the 13 patients.\\n□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□□.\\nAfter repeated verification of the book\'s authenticity, the reporter decided to report to the police.'}

Name: Tattered Newspaper 2
Title: Tattered Newspaper II
SubContent: {1: '#7411 People Initiated Joint Petition for March in Support of Professor Kiril Gorputte\\nAs a renowned psychiatrist and psychologist, Professor Kiril Gorputte had helped countless patients and assisted the police in solving numerous cold cases.\\nThe 13 people he incited to commit suicide all had criminal records but were largely exempt from punishment due to their mental illnesses.\\nAccording to the reporter\'s detailed investigation, during the fifteen years Professor Gorputte worked as a psychiatrist...\\n...he helped the police identify the main perpetrator in nearly a hundred criminal cases as a mentally ill person, out of which thirteen people are believed to have been incited into committing suicide.\\nProfessor Kiril Gorputte revealed in an interview that his motive was simply "to see whether someone who uses mental illness as an excuse to kill would kill themselves because of a mental illness."\\nAnd yet, it still hasn\'t stopped people from speaking out for him.\\nSo far, 7411 people have initiated a joint petition online and organized an offline march.'}

Name: Tattered Newspaper 3
Title: Tattered Newspaper III
SubContent: {1: "#Determination of Sentence for Professor Kiril Gorputte May Prove Difficult\\nThe police have yet to discover further evidence linking Professor Kiril Gorputte to the 13 suicides after his last autobiography was sent out.\\nSupporters have raised doubts whether the autobiography was actually written by Professor Kiril Gorputte himself.\\nWas it by a journalist who has been bribed to send Professor Kiril Gorputte's reputation down the drain? Was Professor Kiril Gorputte forced to write the autobiography?"}

Name: Note Seemingly Soaked Before
Title: Note Seemingly Soaked Before
SubContent: {1: "\\nThe long-haired Ascendant gave us some paper to write down things we want to remember because we might lose some memories after being reborn by Mother.\\nIt was nice of him, but since I'm taking the submarine back tomorrow, there's nothing I really want to leave behind. I'll just write about what has happened these days for later reference.\\nMy friend has already been reborn by Mother and become part of the Sea Fairy. He still remembers me and even small things from our childhood.。\\nBut, well... I feel like he's changed. He used to be humble and timid, but now he feels like a new rich who just won the lottery.\\nI asked him why he became like this, and he said he now understands things he couldn't before and isn't afraid of the unknown or his own powerlessness. Isn't that just being a new rich? It annoyed me just looking at him, so I told the Ascendant I wanted to quit and go back. I didn't expect him to agree, but he did anyway. He arranged a submarine for me. I thought a cult-leader guy like him wouldn't let anyone leave easily, but he said it was unnecessary. Ha, I get him—it's not like the world will be destroyed without me.\\nI don't have much else to share since I slept on the way. Everything just doesn't feel real. Even if I tell other people, they'll think I'm crazy... especially when I talk about Mother... I always dream of her... It's like I can forget all the bad things when I look at her.\\nI'll miss her."}

Name: Note With Blurred Text
Title: Note With Blurred Text
SubContent: {1: "\\nThe Ascendant gave me some paper to write down things I wanted to remember. So I copied my terminal diaries here.\\n\\nDecember 7 Sunny\\nThis is ridiculous. Today I caught several defectors who claimed that the recalling thing was a lie. How could it be? I don't believe Babylonia would send us to dangerous battlefields without a backup plan. But they insisted, making it sound so real. I got pissed and pulled out my gun to shoot him in the leg right there. Defecting just because of some inflammatory speech. Risking their lives. For what? Have they lost their mind?\\n\\nDecember 29\\nI asked boss about the recalling. So now I'm in Cthylla's Cradle.\\nIt's ridiculous, right?"}

Name: Half of A Soaked Letter
Title: Half of A Soaked Letter
SubContent: {1: "\\nThere's nothing I feel compelled to record on paper. I'll just write about the story of my friend.\\nAuntie Linda, as I called her, worked as a CPF maintenance technician. After her persistent efforts, her request for supplies and a rebuilding team was finally approved on her 44th birthday by Babylonia. This allowed her and her friend to return to the conservation area where she used to live.\\nThat wasn't an ideal place to live in, particularly for the elderly and vulnerable, but she was determined to rebuild it.\\nShe believed that the aftermath of the Pulia Forest Park disaster still lingered and felt a personal responsibility to contribute, especially considering it was where her husband had lost his life while protecting her when the calamity erupted.\\nFollowing that, we didn't communicate for about six months. When I heard from her again, it was about the untimely death of her friend, under mysterious circumstances. He vanished while sitting in the CPF, only to be found ten miles away, with half of his body devoured by Hetero-Creatures.\\nAuntie Linda always said it was no accident. According to her, someone coveted the rebuilding project and sought to take control after realizing it wasn't as perilous as rumored. She and her friend had rejected them, and shortly after, the unfortunate incident occurred.\\nAs the task of managing the entire rebuilding team became overwhelming, Auntie Linda eventually still agreed to collaborate with others. However, a person aware of the inner workings, a remnant of the past like her, was nothing but an eyesore to them.\\nThey would sneer at her, questioning how her friend could have died if she had been diligently watching over the CPF. They would mockingly remark that if she had agreed earlier and with more people involved, his death could have been avoided.\\n\\n(It seems there's a second page of this letter...)"}

Name: Other Half of A Soaked Letter
Title: Other Half of A Soaked Letter
SubContent: {1: '\\nGradually, Auntie Linda\'s authority was undermined. Whenever she approached the CPF, others would dismiss her, saying either, "Just leave it, Auntie Linda!" or "Let the professional handle it. Just leave it, Auntie Linda!"\\nI suggested she leave the place, but she said it\'d be hard finding another technical job at her age, given her tendency to make errors in precision technology work. Moreover, this conservation area was her home.\\nIn an effort to gain acceptance from the team that treated her as an outsider, Auntie Linda discovered that the leader coveted an antique painting from the Golden Age. She learned that he would agree to anything if someone presented him with that painting as a gift.\\n...I\'m still unsure how she managed to get her hands on that painting. The last time we met, she had lost four teeth, yet she cheerfully told me that the painting had been given away. Initially, the boss seemed reluctant, but upon feeling her sincerity, he eventually accepted it.\\nAfter that encounter, I never saw Auntie Linda again, except to learn of her tragic fate. On the morning the rebuilding of the conservation area was completed, she leaped from the roof of a building.\\nWhen I rushed to the scene, her blood had vanished, covered by the red carpet where the host stood during the rebuilding celebration.\\n...\\nI couldn\'t understand what exactly happened to her as she couldn\'t understand why her friend was found dead ten miles away, but now I can.\\nThat\'s why I\'m here.'}

Name: Note in a Serum Tube
Title: Note in a Serum Tube
SubContent: {1: "\\nI think I saw the Gray Raven Commandant... but that person seemed to have forgotten everything. What the hell is going on? Did I mistake it?\\n\\n(Followed by another person's handwriting)\\n\\nI also met one who looked almost exactly the same. Was it really the commandant?"}

Name: Memo with Scribbled Words
Title: Memo with Scribbled Words
SubContent: {1: "\\nToday, Mister replicated my M.I.N.D. again, saying that I can't be involved in that project anymore.\\nThere must be something he's concerned about. Is it because of the contact with the Babylonia Task Force?"}

Name: Diary Page Found in Wrecked Utopia
Title: Diary Page Found in Wrecked Utopia
SubContent: {1: "\\nDate: X Month: X\\nThe examination was finished. We found a gem in this batch.\\nShe is young—about three to four years old.\\nThe older kids say no one knows where she's from. The girl seemed to have just shown up out of nowhere one day when they woke up during their escape.\\nAs far as I'm concerned, she's a godsend. I've named her Alisa, and I'm going to raise her myself.\\nI'm going to teach her things and turn her into what I want her to be...\\nThere is no doubt she's going to be the best."}

Name: Note Written in Task Force's Secret Code
Title: Note Written in Task Force's Secret Code
SubContent: {1: "\\n(The text on the note is hurriedly scribbled. The person seems to be in an extremely chaotic state of mind while writing it.)\\n\\n—We finally got out. We finally left that horrifying place, with the help of Lena and Alisa.\\nBut they didn't make it.\\nPeople of the Utopia lab are still hunting us down. We must stay on our toes.\\nWe'll leave messages in Task Force's secret code along the way. If any Construct from Babylonia Task Force sees our messages...\\nPlease go save Lena. Please go save Alisa."}

Name: Documents about Project Cthylla 1
Title: Documents about Project Cthylla I
SubContent: {1: 'We discovered documents related to Project Cthylla on the surface, the authenticity of which cannot be verified. This project is currently ineffective for those brain-dead or with severe brain damage or disease.\\n3. According to Article 1092 from "Science and Technology Progress and Protection Act" by the World Government, those who sign relevant agreements and receive special benefits will receive a notification from us upon admission. In addition to the data of your consciousness, you also agree to leave your biological data with us.\\n4. Once your consciousness is digitized, we will not be able to offer visitation rights of any form.\\n\\nSignature of Subject or Family Member: ___________'}
